properties.name: East St. Louis Race Riot
properties.description: Starting as a labor dispute, this riot escalated into a violent attack on the Black community in East St. Louis, Illinois. Estimates of Black casualties range from 40 to over 100.
properties.display_name: East St. Louis, Saint Clair County, Illinois, United States

properties.name: Omaha Race Riot
properties.description: Although not in Iowa, this race riot in neighboring Omaha, Nebraska, saw violent clashes between white and Black residents, resulting in several deaths and significant property damage.
properties.display_name: Omaha, Douglas County, Nebraska, United States

properties.name: Springfield Race Riot
properties.description: Springfield, Illinois, is not far from Iowa's border. The 1908 riot involved white mobs attacking the Black community after allegations of a Black man assaulting a white woman.
properties.display_name: Springfield, Sangamon County, Illinois, United States

properties.name: Chester Race Riot
properties.description: In Chester, Illinois, a mob of white citizens attacked the Black community after a Black man was accused of assaulting a white woman.
properties.display_name: Chester, Randolph County, Illinois, United States

properties.name: Quincy Race Riot
properties.description: Quincy, Illinois, experienced racial violence in 1908 following the arrest of a Black man. The riot resulted in deaths and extensive property damage.
properties.display_name: Quincy, Adams County, Illinois, United States

properties.name: Keokuk Race Riot
properties.description: While not a large-scale massacre, the Keokuk Race Riot involved violence between white and Black residents, primarily due to labor tensions and segregationist sentiments.
